summary: This is an internal email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, sent on the eve of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial. It is a motivational message to colleagues, asserting the importance of prosecuting the case despite its age, stating that Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls, and providing logistical details for the trial's opening.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal trial 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell'. The email states she sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable kids.

persons.name: Jake Fro
persons.context: Appears as a sender/recipient in the email chain header, thanking someone for a message.

events.title: Opening of Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The start of the trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, involving peremptory challenges, preliminary instructions, and opening statements.

locations: Florida (mentioned as a contrast to SDNY's approach)
keyFacts: The email frames the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell as a critical pursuit of justice for sex crimes dating back to 1994.
It explicitly accuses Ghislaine Maxwell of sexually exploiting underage girls and causing unspeakable harm to vulnerable children.

The message contrasts the Southern District of New York's willingness to prosecute old cases with an implied criticism of prosecutors elsewhere (specifically mentioned as Florida) who might be afraid to do so.
It provides specific logistical details for the trial's opening day, including multiple overflow courtrooms and a dedicated feed for office staff.
